Origin Story Demo Features Team Special Thanks Project Status

Funding Finder

Connecting small businesses to funding and assistance organizations in the greater Washington Area


Our Origin Story

Small businesses have been hit hard by COVID-19 and need support to stay in operation. Recognizing that not all communities have equal information access, we worked with the Washington State Department of Commerce to create Funding Finder, a website that connects small businesses to funding opportunities, assistance organizations, and resources.


During development we prioritized the needs of Tribal small businesses, a community whose needs are often unmet. Funding Finder was designed alongside community representatives and business owners to offer an easy to use platform listing financial support to keep these businesses afloat and address information access.

Why Funding Finder

Funding Made Simple

Save your time searching for funding, we'll do all the heavy lifting

Diversity at the Forefront

Extensive research to ensure inclusivity

One Stop Shop

We've got resources, assistance, and funding options all in one place

Demo Video

Product Features

Browse Funding & Assistance Options

Small businesses can view available funding and assistance. Funding are grants or loans. The assistance results consists of assistance orgs that have financial or technology experts.

Matching Form

Small businesses can fill it out and it will narrow down the funding and assistance organizations they match with. It helps them find the best matches for their business.

Library

The financial literacy library that has a plethora of external links to resources and information that will help users become financially literate and prepare them for applying to funding.

Commerce CMS

Commerce can edit the available assistance and funding with the Administrator Content Management System. This will keep our funding and information up to date and relevant long after we have finished with capstone.

Sarah Lee

Project Sponsor

Sarah Lee

She is currently WA Dept. of Commerce's Director of Advanced Manufacturing. She has been leading the direction of this project. By connecting us with different government agencies and stakeholders, this project wouldn't have been possible without her support.

Ernie Rasmussen

Commerce Tribal Liaison & Small Business Owner

Ernie Rasmussen

Our biggest supporter. He has connected Funding Finder with many Native small business stakeholders and provided us opportunities to present our project at large conferences, like Native Edge Institute.

Tessa Campbell

Capstone Advisor

Tessa Campbell

She has provided us access to several small businesses and has given us valuable insights as both an instructor and a member of the Tulalip tribe.

And our other partners...

We came into this project with little knowledge of small business funding. But as we met with the following individuals from the Safe Start Grant group and various small businesses, we learned more. In total, we spent over 80 hours learning more about the topic area.

Project Status

Our project will be handed off to Restart Partners, a non-profit that is also collaborating with Commerce on another technology project
